title: Review: The Sea Is Rising, but the Dance Goes On
description: For her piece at Madison Square Park, Beau Bree Rhee has come up with a term, “climate change bodies,” but not a dance vocabulary that expresses that idea.
dc:creator: Brian Seibert
media:credit: Rachel Papo for The New York Times
media:description: From left, Caitlin Scranton, Cara McManus, Beau Bree Rhee and Bria Bacon in “Shadow of the Sea,” at Madison Square Park.
